task.title: Two meanings of "structure"
task.shortdesc: Structure can mean the assembly of documents from small building blocks called "topics", and also a consistent internal structure using a text mark-up language.

section.title: Mark up separares meaning from presentation
section.p: It can be difficult to adject to this, particulary when you are used to having easy control of document presentatin with a word proessor, and especially when the output is less satidfactory than you can acheive with one.
Nevertheless, after time, it does become much simper to just open a file and start work without being botherede by page layout, margins, and font size.

In DITA, there is still some structure to consider. Italics and bold are there. (LaTe uses markup "emph" for emphasis, which is more ideally presentation free) and images need to be given a size for PDF output, or they spill overthe page. It's still much, much less than you will find with a word processor.
